name: Orange
goal:
Orange is one of the world’s leading telecommunications providers with 150,711 employees worldwide and sales of 41.4 billion euros for the year 2018. The Group invested 7.4 billion euros in 2018.

In 2018, Orange had a customer base of 264 million customers in 27 countries. The Group had 56.2 million 4G customers. Orange was n°1 in FTTH in Europe in 2018 with 29 million homes that will be able to be connected. Under the brand Orange Business Services, Orange is also a world leader in providing ICT services to multinational companies with local presence in over 160 countries and territories.

The following network operators are part of Orange in member states of the European Union:
Orange SA (FR),
Orange Belgium (BE)
Orange Luxembourg (LU)
Orange Polska (PL)
Orange Romania (RO)
Orange Slovensko (SK)
Orange Spain (SP)


The Brussels Representation of Orange covers actions and developments in Europe related to electronic communications, ICT for competitiveness, sustainable development and innovation. Its mission is to maintain relationships with key EU players and policymakers, and to bring the Group expertise to European debates, initiatives and actions.
Orange's ambition is to contribute to the success of the Digital Agenda for Europe and to support Europe’s competitiveness in the global economy.

Orange's involvement covers a wide range of topics, including: fixed and wireless broadband development and investment; cybersecurity, the data economy (data protection & privacy); R&D and innovation, including Artificial Intelligence; broadband content and services; Verticals and the IoT (e-health, smart cities, connected mobility/transport, connected industry etc..) for daily life and business; banking; ICT for sustainable development; corporate social responsibility (CSR), diversity, skills and development.
interests: Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
